titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Edward Baker Jr. et al., Indictment
CWG0982

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p: Memorandum of indictments found at the June term 1865 of the Caldwell Circuit Court against Edward Baker Jr & others.
For permitting F. W. Dabbney a minor to play on a Jennie Lind Table, without the written permission of his parents.

W. E. Mitchersson & Edward Baker Jr
For Keeping a J gaming table, towit, a Jennie Lind table, they being licensed coffee house keepers.

Edward Baker Jr & S. M. Miller
Permitting gaming in a house with cards on a Jennie Lind table.

Edward Baker Jr & S. M. Miller
Permitting minors, towit, Fisk Overby, W. Owen and William Denny, to game upon a Jennie Lind table.

Edward Baker Jr and S. M. Miller.
Permitting minors to play in a Jennie Lind table towit E. B. Ford, Robert Overby and George Coon.

Edward Baker Jr and S. M. Miller
Keeping a gaming table, towit: a Jennie Lind table

Edward Baker and L. D. Gardner
Gaming on Pigeon hole table.
Memorandum of Indictments against Edward Baker Jr &c"
